thread.title: LIVE: Pupils showing support for Zuma as more MPs arrive on the red carpet before #SONA2017 | News24
thread.title_full: LIVE: Pupils showing support for Zuma as more MPs arrive on the red carpet before #SONA2017 | News24

title: LIVE: Pupils showing support for Zuma as more MPs arrive on the red carpet before #SONA2017 | News24
text:
— Thulani Gqirana (@ThulaniGqirana) February 9, 2017 16:12 Copy URL: Share Icon 
There is a heavy police presence in the Cape Town CBD, and military vehicles arrived in town earlier in the afternoon. Quiet outside #Parly except #SAPS who didn't want me to take any pictures. No reason. But I got this one #SONA2017 pic.twitter.com/CH4rodq9An — Sakina Kamwendo (@SakinaKamwendo) February 9, 2017 16:08 Copy URL: Share Icon 
ANC chief whip Jackson Mthembu said President Jacob Zuma’s state of the nation address would go ahead, whether there are disruptions or not. 
On Thursday morning, he said he was uncertain if SONA would be disrupted. 
“Well, we don’t know. Whether there are or not, we will continue. All I can assure you is that the state of the nation address will continue and we will hear the president speak about what is important in the lives of our people.”
